The detective buys a newspaper from a VENDOR, about to wa away when he sees the cover of the DAILY NEWS. He picks i and opens it, searching for a section. Finds it, reads it eyes growing wider.
The Connecticut architect who Moves said failed to pay a 135 thousand dollar bill he'd racked up during four visits to the club.
The detective shows the article to the other detective.
“For a night of pleasure he can’t even remember...” What a boob. INT. NYC PRECINCT - SARGEANT’S OFFICE - LATER The detectives show the SERGEANT (60s).  92.
So the guy got drugged and then went back three more times? Guess he must've liked it. They all share a hearty laugh.
The two detectives talk to Elizabeth.
When you look at it out of context it seems like he’s making it up...
We see Annabelle with the handsy architect.
An architect. Whoa.
The architect gives a statement to a SKEPTICAL COP (50s).
But when we put it together with Doug, it all added up...
Peter, these are my sisters! We PUSH in on Annabelle as she looks up at Ramona, Destin and Mercedes coming to the rescue.
It's scary isn't it?
Elizabeth looks at the two detectives.
I mean we all got so spooked...none of us went to the club anymore.  93. Elizabeth writes something down, stifles a smile.
Destiny puts the DAILY NEWS down in front of Ramona, open the architect article. Ramona looks at it. Doesn’t flinch
Good. Maybe now he’1l pay his bill. Ramona goes back to filing her nails. Destiny looks at he Ghost white. Terrified. Destiny swallows.

CUE: Lorde’s “Royals” May 23, 2013. We follow the back of Ramona's head, as she walks down the sidewalk. She’s in athleisure, carrying he gym bag. She waves to a neighbor. We follow Ramona all the way to the corner store. She sto in front of an ATM, her back to the street. Slides her ca Gets out $200. No receipt. Cash in hand. Turns around. The COPS have her surrounded, their guns drawn. They didn make a sound. Ramona puts her fists in the air.
Hands where we can see ‘em! Ramona has great difficulty opening her fists. She finall does. The money flies out of her hands and down the stree
Mercedes, dressed up, visits HER BOYFRIEND (20s) in priso She squeezes his hand, a giant engagement ring on her fin
The GUARD walks Mercedes outside. Her heels click on the pavement. The gate opens. A row of COPS waits for her. Sh looks at them. Then looks back at the prison. Confused.

INT. ANNABELLE’S APARTMENT —- MORNING Annabelle feeds her cat, then sits with a cup of tea, in pajamas. Her cell buzzes. It’s a TEXT from Destiny: Run. There’s a KNOCK at the door. Annabelle looks up. Then bur from her seat. Grabs her cat. The door is kicked in. Annabelle tries to climb out the fire escape but the COPS grab her. The cat jumps out of her arms. Annabelle throws

Oh God, I’m sorry... The cops put her in hand-cuffs, trying to avoid the vomit EXT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - MORNING We follow the back of Destiny’s head as she walks out her front door, hands in the air, surrendering. EXT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER They put her in the back of a car. She sees Lily in the neighbor's arms, watching her. Destiny tries to look stro
Destiny joins Ramona, Mercedes and Annabelle. They’re lik different exotic birds chirping in a cage. Annabelle is crying, vomit on her shirt. The detective steps up.
Which one of you’s the ringleader? Destiny and Ramona look at each other...
The two detectives walk Ramona into the room.
This is unbelievable. You guys really are something, you know that? Does Tony know about this?
Sit down, Miss Vega. Ramona sits.  95.
We didn’t do anything wrong. This is crazy. Tony wouldn’t let this happen. I’m texting him. She pulls out her phone.
Tony doesn’t...who gave her her phone back?
The two detectives sit across from Destiny. Destiny looks terrified. We PUSH in on her face as we hear their voices
«+. think about your daughter.
You're facing felony charges here. You really want to go down for someone else?
You want Lily to grow up without her mother?
You think these girls are your friends? You think they’re not gonna rat you out?
Think about your daughter...
Ramona and Destiny walk down the steps of the precinct. Destiny looks dazed, beaten. Ramona’s looking at her phon plotting, as they make their way down the sidewalk.
Mercedes’11 probably use Dragon’s lawyer, so you and me and Annabelle should probably lawyer up. Do we know any lawyers from the club? That guy Jeremy. Or maybe Anton?
.+-. I took the deal.  96. Ramona stops. Turns to her.
«+. you did? Destiny nods her head, starts to cry. Ramona looks at her And explodes:
Have I taught you fucking nothing? Ramona paces.
You stupid fucking idiot what the fuck is wrong with you? Ramona grabs Destiny by the shoulders and shakes her.
How could you do that??

-- Lily. Ramona stops. She looks at Destiny. Ramona clenches her teeth, but her chin starts to tremble. Ramona shakes her head. Then pulls Destiny in by the shoulders. They hug ea other, crying on each other’s shoulders.
Motherhood’s a mental illness. Ramona holds Destiny in her arms. They know this is it fo them. This is goodbye.
--. I’m sorry. Ramona shakes her head. She squeezes Destiny tight, angry tears on her cheeks.
«+. we were fucking hurricanes, weren’t we? Ramona pulls away first. Destiny’s arms are still reachin out as Ramona walks away from her.
It is quiet. Then... a RINGING PHONE takes us to...  97. INT. ELIZABETH’S HOUSE - DAY [2014] Elizabeth, now pregnant, answers her phone. In the background, a BABY SHOWER in progress. It’s a girl.
Hello?
Elizabeth...it’s Destiny.
Hey, Destiny. How are you?
INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - SAME Destiny sits in her living room. Her voice almost echoes the emptiness. No sound except her jewelry.
Good. Really good. Lily’s good. Um...we’re moving back to Queens. But...I’ve been making a ton of new friends. And I met a man who’s helping me get a job in pharmaceuticals. Are you still there?
I’m here, Destiny.
Well, I’ve been thinking about things and...maybe the reason we did what we did? Is cause hurt people hurt people. You know? Elizabeth opens a door to another room.
Have you talked to Ramona lately?
No...just the one time. (then) Have you?
No... Destiny looks across the room at her daughter playing.  98.
Can I ask you... (then) What else did she say about me?
Ramona sits across from Elizabeth, now in the manager's chair. There’s a warmth between them. Ramona has her big open on the desk.

++. so I was living in the Bronx at the time but I was seeing this guy who had this walk-up right next to where I stripped, so I was staying at his place like every night...and then this one morning, I went back to my place and my front door was wide open and it just freaked me out, you know? That all my stuff, all my valuable stuff was in this place that I wasn’t even sleeping in...so now I just carry everything with me all the time. Ramona opens up her bag and begins a show-and-tell.

This was a patch from my grandpa’s uniform. He was in the Navy. This was my grandma’s wedding band and this was my mother’s, see the three birthstones are me and my sisters. Elizabeth looks at her, endeared.
One lives in Texas, the other one’s in Arizona. We try to get together once a year but it’s impossible with kids. Do you have kids?
Not yet.
Oh don’t worry, you’re young. You have amazing skin. Everyone must tell you that.  99. Elizabeth notices something in the bag.
Is that you? She points at a photo of a YOUNG GIRL. Ramona laughs.
Yeah, that’s me. A senior asked me to the prom. Look how terrified. I like my dress though. Ramona pulls another photo out from behind it. LITTLE DESTINY. We recognize her sweet face.
And that’s Dorothy. Wasn’t she the cutest? Who could leave this baby? Ramona gazes lovingly at the photo of Little Destiny.

We used to say...if only we had known each other back then...you know? Maybe we could’ve...been there for each other...and maybe our whole lives would’ve been different, you know? She looks at the two photos side-by-side. Ramona at fifte Destiny at five. Ramona gets em at the thought. Tears in eyes for the first time. She smiles them away.

Maybe it’d be the same. Who knows. I can’t talk to her. But...I still like to carry her with me. Ramona puts her childhood photo face-to-face with Destiny childhood photo and slides them back in their place.
INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - DAY Destiny holds the phone to her ear. A tear falls.

head_text.subj: DESTINY AND RAMONA'S FRIENDSHIP IN REVERSE

text: Looking at each other in jail  100. Fighting each other on the floor Holding hands at Grandma’s funeral Dancing with the “family” at Christmas Holding hands at the diner Hugging each other again after the crash Destiny trying on Ramona's bathing suit Ramona helping Destiny with the money in her boot Destiny wrapped in Ramona's fur coat, their heads on top each other.
You should give her a call, Destiny.
INT. DESTINY’S HOUSE - DAY Destiny nods, wiping away the tears, and smiles.
«+. yeah.
Destiny pled guilty to conspiracy, grand larceny and attempted assault in exchange for zero jail time.
Ramona served five years probation.
Mercedes and Annabelle were sentenced to weekends in pris and are now on five years’ probation.  101.
The world turns. Another night in the club, the floor pac with men paying to watch the women dance. As we witness t exchange, we hear a familiar voice...
There's really nothing I can say to make sense of what went down. But everybody's hustling... INT. RAMONA’S OFFICE - THE DAY OF HER INTERVIEW Ramona looks just past us.
This city, this whole country is a strip club. You got people tossing the money. And people doing the dance.
CUE: Janet Jackson's “Miss You Much”...

One last time everybody, let's hear it for our girls! INT. RAMONA’S APARTMENT - FLASHBACK The night of their first big score. Destiny, Ramona, Mercedes, and Annabelle are celebrating together. Janet i playing. They’re lined up in the living room.
The four girls do choreographed moves together, laughing, cracking up, dancing with each other, dancing for themsel
